newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish economy grew around 3 pct in spring 1997.
newsitem.headline: Spanish economy grew around 3 pct in spring 1997.

text.p: Economy Secretary Cristobal Montoro said on Wednesday that the Spanish economy grew at around three percent in spring 1997.
"With all certainty we can say that Spain grew at around three percent (in terms of) economic activity in the spring of 1997," Montoro told a seminar in Madrid.
He added that this was fuelling substantial jobs growth.
In the last quarter of 1996 Spanish gross domestic product grew 2.6 percent year-on-year.
Montoro added this sustained rate of growth is based on a very solid basis, with inflation and the public deficit declining.
The public administration budget deficit is expected to be at 3.0 percent of GDP in 1997, he said.
Montoro reiterated that the consumer price index will fall below two percent year-on-year to historic lows soon.
"This is key to the convergence plan of the government which will allow a reduction in the deficit and cuts in taxes".
He also reiterated that Spain is one of the strongest candidates for European Economic and Monetary Union.
